snippet: Anonymous hackers claimed responsibility for leaking 55,000 hacked Twitter accounts on Tuesday. But a closer look revealed about half were duplicates and that most had been suspended by Twitter.
abstract: Anonymous hackers claimed responsibility for leaking 55,000 hacked Twitter accounts on Tuesday. But a closer look revealed about half were duplicates and that most had been suspended by Twitter.

byline.original: By NICK BILTON and NICOLE PERLROTH

headline.main: The Twitter Hack Attack That Wasn't
